p: The commercial oregano oil inhibited the growth of all the tested strains of bacteria E. coli in the concentrations ranging from 0.5% to 2%, yet, the maximum zone of inhibition bacteria growth was present at concentrations of 0.5% and 1%. The E. coli ATTC 10536 strain proved to be the most sensitive to the oil activity. However, no biocidal activity was observed of clove macerate against the tested bacterial strains ( Figure 7).
